content.description: The entrance to Brownie Basin is guarded by a 400 foot high granite peak on the south that offers several multi-pitch offerings.  The camping is good and the views are great.  There is quality bouldering at Laverty Lakes as well as great swimming.     P1 - Find the lowest point on the rock slab face, follow shallow cracks and edges upward for 120 feet.   P2 - From the belay ledge, move right and follow broken ledges upward for another 100 feet.   P3 - move up and and then right for 50 feet or so, traversing a vertical slab for 50 feet, then straight up to the summit knife edge ridge.
content.protection: Standard rack - small tri-cams are usefull in shallow bottoming cracks.
content.location: Descent - rappel from trees.  1 rope is adequate.

climbs.name: Brownie Basin - Chimney Point - The Slab

content.description:
Enjoyable granite slab on the west face of Chimney Point. Friction route with 6 bolts. 

  Source: Climbing 119
content.location: West face of Chimney Point which is Brownie Basin
